Body:
Are there examples of creole languages that have had three or more other languages as parents without intermediate two-language creoles? If they exist, then how high is the 'or more', i.e. what is the largest n such that a direct n-language creole exists? If the answer is no, is there a fundamental reason for this?

This question is partially motivated by thinking for the reproductive part of Evolution of languages
Title: Are there creoles of three languages?
